articles.author: Nellie Peyton, Nandita Bose
articles.description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa heads to the White House on Wednesday on a perilous mission to persuade a hostile Donald Trump to make deals with his country rather than scold and punish it as he has done since the start of his second term.
articles.title: South Africa's Ramaphosa faces Trump with deals on offer and golfers in tow

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Palestinians in Gaza were left waiting for the promised arrival of food on Wednesday despite mounting international and domestic pressure on the Israeli government to allow more aid to reach a population on the brink of famine after an 11-week blockade.
articles.title: Gaza still waiting for aid as pressure mounts on Israel

articles.author: Tom Balmforth
articles.description: A previously unreported Ukrainian white paper to be presented to the EU calls for the 27-member bloc to take a more aggressive and independent position on sanctions as uncertainty hangs over Washington's future role.
articles.title: Exclusive: Ukraine pitches tougher Russia sanctions plan to EU as US wavers

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi, John Irish
articles.description: While rising U.S.-Iran tensions over Tehran's uranium enrichment jeopardize nuclear talks, three Iranian sources said on Tuesday that the clerical leadership lacks a clear fallback plan if efforts to resolve a decades-long dispute collapse.
articles.title: Iran faces U.S. without Plan B as nuclear red lines collide

articles.author: Emma Pinedo, Inti Landauro
articles.description: Unidentified gunmen shot dead a former Ukrainian politician on Wednesday outside a school in a wealthy suburb of Madrid, Spain's Interior Ministry said.
articles.title: Ukrainian ex-politician shot dead outside elite American school in Madrid

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli military said that it fired near a diplomatic delegation which it said deviated from an approved route in the occupied West Bank on Wednesday.
articles.title: Israeli soldiers fire near diplomats on visit to occupied West Bank

articles.author: Saleem Ahmed
articles.description: At least four children were killed by a suicide bomber who targeted an army school bus in Pakistan's restive Balochistan province, a government official said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Blast targeting school bus kills four children in Pakistan's Balochistan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. singer Chris Brown was on Wednesday granted bail by a London court after he was charged with a serious assault, clearing the way for his world tour to begin next month.
articles.title: US singer Chris Brown granted bail by UK court ahead of world tour

articles.author: Fatos Bytyci
articles.description: Kosovo's parliament failed to elect a new speaker for the 15th straight time on Wednesday, prompting fears of an economic backlash after months of political stalemate in one of Europe’s poorest countries.
articles.title: Kosovo's political stalemate could put EU funds at risk, trade body warns

articles.author: Angelo Amante, Giuseppe Fonte
articles.description: NATO will raise the defence spending target for its member nations to between 3.5% and 5% of gross domestic product (GDP) from the current 2% at the next alliance summit in June, Italy's Defence Minister Guido Crosetto said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Italy expects NATO to raise defence spending target to between 3.5% and 5% of GDP
